medical_history.chief_complaint: Hyponatremia and involuntary movements of the arm and face.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in his usual health until 5 weeks prior, when he developed fatigue, requiring rest after walking a quarter-mile. He began unusual daytime napping. Three weeks before admission, laboratory tests revealed hyponatremia, leading to an emergency visit. After initial treatment, fatigue diminished but involuntary movements in the left arm and hand developed a week later, described as spasms lasting less than 5 seconds, often triggered by position changes. Frequency increased during the following weeks.
medical_history.family_history: Heart disease in the father and pancreatic cancer in the mother.
medical_history.social_history: Former tobacco smoker, quit 40 years ago; rare alcohol use; no illicit drug use; retired teacher living with wife.
